search_parameters.q: Sexism in Single-Sex and Coeducational Independent Secondary School Classrooms. Lee, Valerie E. And Others Sociology of Education

search_information.query_displayed: Sexism in Single-Sex and Coeducational Independent Secondary School Classrooms. Lee, Valerie E. And Others Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Sexism in single-sex and coeducational independent secondary school classrooms
organic_results.snippet: This study investigated how engenderment (socialization to gender) operates in three types of independent secondary schools--boys' schools, girls' schools, and coeducational schools. Observational data were collected in 86 classrooms in 21 schools in specific curricular areas. The study found that teachers initiated most of the incidents in six categories of sexism. Furthermore, although the frequency of incidents was similar in the three types of schools, the forms of sexism were different. Chemistry classes were the major locus of …

publication_info.summary: VE Lee, HM Marks, T Byrd - Sociology of education, 1994 - JSTOR
